title: No, Israel hasn’t chosen to avoid 5G technology. It is fake news
subtitle: Israel government is set to launch a long-awaited tender for fifth generation (5G) mobile network in their country this month (July-2019).
author: factly.in
vclaim:
“Well surprise, surprise! Despite Israel being intimately involved with the creation of 5G technologies, they have chosen to avoid it like the plague” claims a Facebook post. Let’s to analyze to what extent the claim made in the post is true.

Claim: Israel has chosen to avoid the launch of 5G technology in its country. Fact: Israel government is set to launch a long-awaited tender for fifth generation (5G) mobile network in their country this month (July-2019). So, the claim made in the post is FALSE.

A quick Google Search with keywords “Israel 5g launch”, results in a “Reuters” article with the title “Israel set to launch long-awaited 5G tender this month”. In the article published on July 2, 2019, it was reported that an Israel government spokesperson has said that their country is likely to launch a long-awaited tender for the fifth generation (5G) mobile networks within two weeks. Israel’s Communications Ministry had said late last year that it hoped to allocate frequencies for 5G technology by the end of 2019 and launch it commercially between 2020 and 2023. The ministry has said that 5G is necessary to develop health, agriculture and education, as well as smart cities and self-driving cars.

To conclude, Israel hasn’t chosen to avoid the launch of 5G technology in its country. It is fake news.
